main event: In mid-March 1966, multiple witnesses reported seeing unusual lights and a potential UFO in the marshy areas of Southern Michigan, particularly in Dexter and Hillsdale.
interesting points: The sightings involved multiple witnesses, including a civil defense director and law enforcement officers, who described seeing glowing lights and a distinct object,The lights were noted to have colors of red, green, and yellow with a tendency to rise and fall smoothly,Observations were made near swamps, which led some investigators to suggest that the phenomenon could be explained by marsh gas,Dr. J. Allen Hynek stated that reasonable conclusions could be made about swamp gas and there was no concrete evidence supporting extraterrestrial craft,Despite the suggestions of marsh gas as an explanation, many witnesses reported sightings that did not satisfactorily fit this theory, raising questions about the accuracy of the explanation.
sighted object: glowing lights and an unidentified object
witness description: Witnesses included law enforcement officers, civil defense officials, and college students.
